title: Learning When to Look: A Disentangled Curriculum for Strategic Perception in Multimodal Reasoning
summary: Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) demonstrate significant potential but remain brittle in complex, long-chain visual reasoning tasks. A critical failure mode is "visual forgetting", where models progressively lose visual grounding as reasoning extends, a phenomenon aptly described as "think longer, see less".
